description: The National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics, which oversees some 83,000 athletes competing in more than 25 sports, is thought to be the first college sports organization to take such a step.
title: NAIA all but bans transgender athletes from women's sports

description: Truth Social shares fell sharply for a second consecutive day, wiping out billions of dollars from the value of Donald J. Trump's stake.
title: Trump's Truth Social shares are plunging again, erasing billions of dollars in value

description: Montreal is in the path of totality, and its largest eclipse-watching event is taking place in Parc Jean-Drapeau.
title: Montreal reports great conditions for a solar eclipse watch party in the park

description: Eye damage is rare and sometimes temporary, but it never hurts to get it checked.
title: Worried that watching the eclipse damaged your eyes? Don't panic

description: NASA debunks these and other myths: Will a solar eclipse harm a pregnant woman's baby if she looks at it? Does an eclipse emit special radiation that can instantly blind you?
title: Solar eclipse myths and rumors bubble up, from radiation to food poisoning

description: Food and beverage franchises are celebrating the eclipse with discounts and special offers for customers across the U.S., regardless of whether they're in the path of totality.
title: Hungry for eclipse deals? These food and drink chains have you covered

description: Food and beverage franchises are celebrating the eclipse with discounts and special offers for customers across the U.S., regardless of whether they're in the path of totality.
title: Hungry for eclipse deals? These food and drink chains have you covered

description: The Mexican city of Mazatlán is the first place the total solar eclipse will be visible as it emerges over the Pacific Ocean today, and the weather here is perfect.
title: Mexico's beach party is excited to see the eclipse first emerge

description:
Aviva Siegel was among the more than 200 Israelis taken hostage by Hamas on October 7th. She was held 51 days before being released. Her husband, Keith, who is a U.S. citizen, is still being held in Gaza. We hear about Aviva Siegel's time in captivity and her advocacy for the release of Keith and the remaining hostages.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
title: Held Hostage by Hamas for 51 Days

description: A Brazilian Supreme Court justice included Elon Musk as a target in an ongoing investigation over the dissemination of fake news and opened a separate investigation into Musk for alleged obstruction.
title: Brazil's Supreme Court judge opens an investigation of Elon Musk over misinformation

description: The eclipse is fast approaching the U.S. Cities and states in the path of totality have issued emergency declarations to help manage traffic, and meteorologists are readying their final forecasts.
title: Americans await the eclipse, with glasses secured and fingers crossed for clear skies

description: The country music star was arrested on four charges, including reckless endangerment and disorderly conduct. The chair, thrown from a rooftop bar, landed on the street close to two police officers.
title: Morgan Wallen arrested for throwing a chair from a rooftop bar in Nashville

description: A NASA-backed program to launch research balloons is designed to study the atmosphere while training students.
title: Hundreds of balloons go airborne to witness the eclipse from the edge of space

description: The actor's once-rocketing career was derailed after he was found guilty of assaulting and harassing his then-girlfriend, Grace Jabbari, during an incident in Manhattan in March 2023.
title: Jonathan Majors avoids jail time in assault and harassment sentencing

description: A document called "Infinite Dignity" details what the Vatican sees as grave violations of dignity. Poverty, war and the abuse of migrants lead the list.
title: The Vatican says surrogacy and gender theory are 'grave threats' to human dignity

description: Alice Claus and her sister were exhausted after a long flight to Budapest. Then a young man on the street offered help right when they needed it.
title: They had 3 suitcases and faced 5 flights of stairs. That's when a stranger appeared

description: Pressure has mounted on Trump to make his own views on abortion public after the Florida Supreme Court allowed the state's six-week ban on abortion to go into effect.
title: Trump declines to back nationwide abortion ban, says it should be left to the states

description: Biden administration targets accrued interest in latest student loan relief proposal. Israel withdraws troops as the Israel-Hamas war reaches the six month mark.
title: Student loan proposal targets accrued interest; Israel and Hamas war hits six months

description: Federal and state regulators are mulling what they can do to thwart the growing problem. Rogue health insurance brokers are switching consumers' plans without permission and collecting the commission.
title: Unauthorized ACA plan switches drives call for action against rogue agents

description: The sweeping new proposals, if enacted, could ease student loan debt for millions of borrowers.
title: Biden seeks student debt relief for millions

description: The head of the U.N.'s atomic watchdog agency on Sunday condemned a Ukrainian drone strike on one of six nuclear reactors at the Russian-controlled Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine.
title: Attacks on Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant increases accident risk, IAEA head says
